intro: Chondrosum hirtum, commonly known as the hairy rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or white flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its hairy leaves and showy blooms make it an attractive and hardy addition to botanical collections.
